questions.question: That was the ……………………… interesting movie I have ever seen.
questions.description: The superlative shows the highest degree.

questions.question: Who is the …………………………. girl in the class?
questions.description: The superlative is used to compare a person or thing to the whole group to which that person or thing belongs.

questions.question: I am not at all ………………………………… with your performance.
questions.description: When there is no idea of comparison we use the positive adjective.

questions.question: The children sang ……………………………..
questions.description: When there is no idea of comparison we use the positive adjective.

questions.question: When I talked to her yesterday, she sounded …………………………….. than ever.
questions.description: Use a comparative expression before than.

questions.question: The teacher encouraged them to work …………………………...
questions.description: Either hard or harder is possible here.

questions.question: That was the …………………………… thing I had ever done.
questions.description: The superlative shows the highest degree.

questions.question: I did much ……………………………….. work today than yesterday.
questions.description: Less is the comparative form of little.

questions.question: I have ………………………… respect for people who ill-treat animals.
She sings ……………………………. than anybody I know.
He is the .................................. man in the village.
questions.description: The superlative is used to compare a person or thing to the whole group to which that person or thing belongs.
